full_title_en: WPSS (WHO classification-based Prognostic Scoring System) for Myelodysplastic Syndrome
medium_description_en: Evaluates prognosis of patients with myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS).

seo.meta_description_en: The WPSS (WHO classification-based Prognostic Scoring System) for Myelodysplastic Syndrome evaluates the prognosis of patients with MDS.
seo.keywords_en: WPSS, WHO, prognostic scoring, Myelodysplastic Syndrome, MDS

*Karyotype is defined as follows: good = normal, –Y, del(5q), del(20q); poor = complex (≥3 abnormalities), chromosome 7 anomalies; and intermediate = all other abnormalities.

**Transfusion requirement is defined as having at least one RBC transfusion every 8 weeks over a period of 4 months.

creator_info.about_en: Luca Malcovati, MD, is a hematologist at the IRCCS Policlinico San Matteo Foundation in Pavia, Italy. He is also an associate professor of hematology in the department of molecular medicine at University of Pavia Medical School. Dr. Malcovati’s research interests include myeloid neoplasms, the prognosis of myelodysplastic syndrome, and providing evidence-based guidelines.
